title: Saban enjoyed meeting with 'the Facebook guy'
text:

Post to Facebook Saban enjoyed meeting with 'the Facebook guy' Sounds about right.  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/nick-saban-meeting-with-the-facebook-guy-mark-zuckerberg-alabama/   Join the Nation's Conversation To   Saban enjoyed meeting with 'the Facebook guy' Andrew Joseph 5:38 p.m. ET Feb. 21, 2017 
Nick Saban and Mark Zuckerberg (Photo: AP and USATSI) 
Alabama head coach Nick Saban had a very interesting meeting on Tuesday with someone you may have heard of: "The Facebook guy." 
Saban was, of course, referring to Facebook co-founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg, who was visiting the Alabama campus on Tuesday. Saban, being way more hip with the social media than Bill Belichick , had some great things to say about that leadership meeting. 
He said via Al.com : 
"I just met with Mark Zuckerberg, the Facebook guy," Saban said, speaking at the 2016 Crime Stopper of the Year Luncheon held in Hoover. "He wanted to know about leadership, and what do you do to affect people." 
Zuckerberg, he said, was aware of the role of football in the state. "It was kind of interesting that he saw the spirit that we have in this state relative to supporting athletics as something that is very special, very unique, and very wholesome in terms of people having the opportunity to create hope whether it's in competition, or something they believe in or a spirit," Saban said. 
It was still awesome that Saban assumed some people didn't know who Zuckerberg was. The guy only created the world's most popular social media platform - no big deal. 
Zuckerberg also enjoyed his meeting with Saban.
